items.title: Messing With the Wrong City
items.abstract: Bostonians don’t love easy things. They love hard things.

items.title: Sustaining Cities on a Crowding Planet
items.abstract: Mayors, builders and others discuss urban options for energy, resilient design, and more on a crowding planet.

items.title: A Tale of Two Rust-Belt Cities
items.abstract: Why has Pittsburgh done so much better?

items.title: Regina Resnik, Metropolitan Opera Star, Dies at 90
items.abstract: Ms. Resnik, a Bronx native who made a mid-career switch from soprano to mezzo-soprano, sang more than 300 performances at the Met.

items.title: Mobsters, Urban Design and Murals
items.abstract: Books about Alphonse D’Arco, a mob informant; designing cities for climate change; and some of the city’s finest murals that don’t hang in museums.

items.title: New York City to Get $176 Million From U.S. for Storm Protections
items.abstract: Senator Chuck Schumer said the city would be awarded federal funds for a proposed project to guard against another storm like Hurricane Sandy in Lower Manhattan.

items.title: How Cities Are Responding to Flooding
items.abstract: The group 100 Resilient Cities details the steps that its partner, the city of Norfolk, Va., is taking.

items.title: How Safe Is Your City From a Flood?
items.abstract: The mayor of New Orleans, a FEMA official and New York City experts discuss the problem of flooding.

items.title: Los Angeles Looks for Extra Water Down Its Alleys
items.abstract: In the fifth year of a drought, Los Angeles wants to convert miles of extra space to capture storm water.

items.title: Boxed In, Freaked Out: A Claustrophobe Navigates a Crowded City
items.abstract: For a claustrophobe, it’s tough to get around a city that relies on elevators and subways.

items.title: Film Club: ‘A Moment in Mexico: Ruptured City’
items.abstract: Aerial footage captures the resilience and humanity of Mexico City’s response to the 2017 earthquake.

items.title: 6 Years After Hurricane Sandy, Here’s What They Came Up With: Really Big Sandbags
items.abstract: City officials will install the sandbags as the first line of defense against storm surges in part of Lower Manhattan.

items.title: Roman Ruins? Sure, but Bulgaria’s Second City Offers So Much More
items.abstract: In Plovdiv, the 52 Places Traveler meets the people who are turning the city into a true capital of culture.

items.title: The New Architecture: Sky Parks, Tidal Pools and ‘Solar Carving’
items.abstract: Projects debuting this fall suggest that hard barriers between the designed environment and the natural one are softening — maybe for good.
keywords: Kennedy, John F, Center for the Performing Arts

items.title: Poor Schools Keep Getting Crushed in Football. Is It Time to Level the Playing Field?
items.abstract: A growing number of states are considering whether economic status should help determine which opponents schools play.

items.title: Is This the Last Generation to Live on New York City’s Wild Fringes?
items.abstract: A major restoration project aims to protect the Jamaica Bay area — and all of New York — by returning salt marshes and sand dunes to their natural states. But will it be too late for the people of Broad Channel?

items.title: A One-Woman Rescue Squad for Homeless Students
items.abstract: The work of Norma Mercado, a Texas school system’s point person for dealing with homeless young people, is benefiting from a big but temporary surge in federal funding.

items.title: Subway Attack Proves City’s Resilience Again: ‘We Don’t Have a Choice’
items.abstract: The fabled toughness of New York’s residents has helped them power through trauma and tragedy. The shooting this week is another test.
keywords: James, Frank R (April 12, 2022 Brooklyn Subway Shooting)

items.title: Sounders’ Breakthrough Title Cements Seattle’s Soccer Bona Fides
items.abstract: The Sounders captured M.L.S.’s first CONCACAF Champions League title with a win over Pumas of Mexico. Our columnist remembers the day soccer took root in Seattle.
keywords: Confederation of North, Central American and Caribbean Association Football (CONCACAF)

items.title: Manchester City Wins Premier League Title After Nearly Kicking It Away
items.abstract: Three second-half goals capped a dramatic final day, and denied Liverpool an improbable championship.
